conversation.speaker: USER
conversation.text: I'm in the mood for a music movie. Could you recommend a few?

conversation.speaker: SYSTEM
conversation.text: Out of the options, I'd highly recommend you check out "The Rocker" (2008). It's a hilarious comedy about a drummer who gets his second chance at stardom with his nephew's band. You might also enjoy "That Thing You Do!" (1996), a charming film about a one-hit wonder band in the 1960s, which features Tom Hanks as well! Both movies offer an enjoyable blend of music and humor. Enjoy your movie time!

If you're in the mood for something lighthearted and music-focused, "Wayne's World" might also be a great choice. It follows two slacker friends promoting their public-access cable show with hilarious results!

If you're looking for something with a more mysterious twist, "Eve's Bayou" might be right up your alley. This film delves into secrets, lies, and mystic forces within an affluent family, featuring notable actresses like Lynn Whitfield and Diahann Carroll.

It's an Irish crime comedy that pairs an unconventional police officer with an uptight FBI agent to investigate an international drug ring. The film stars Don Cheadle and Brendan Gleeson, who deliver engaging performances in this quirky, entertaining movie.

If you're looking for a more dramatic change from your previous preferences, "The Truman Show" (1998) might also appeal to you. This thought-provoking film follows an insurance salesman who discovers his entire life is a reality TV show. Jim Carrey delivers a standout performance as the protagonist in this intriguing and captivating movie.
